main.name: Lior Kaufman
main.description: With  experience in  developing user interfaces, testing, debugging, and a versatile skill set. Proven ability in understanding and implanting new technologies.
main.bio:
My name is Lior Kaufman, I am a resourceful problem solver that is backed with 5 years of
experience in various leadership roles. Passionate about
creating high quality solutions to different problems.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description:
Gained 480+ hours of direct hands-on coding
experience developing web applications utilizing
HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React, Ruby, Rails, AWS,
PostgreSQL and github. Practiced industry best
practices and programming in pair and mob
programming teams.
Accumulated 37 credits with towards a Bachelor's degree. Taken multiple Programming courses in Java and C++ as well as getting into the Dean's Honor List

education.school: Ben Gurion University of the Negev - Israel
education.description: Accumulated 32 credits towards a Bachelor's degree in accounting in Israel.

work.title: Frontend web developer
work.description:
Worked with the web development team on User
Interface features. Refactored existing UI with React
hooks and Redux latest features. Wrote unit and
integration tests using Jest and Enzyme. Increased
code test coverage by 10%. Resolved bugs and issues as
reported by users and team.

work.title: Bartender
work.description:
Displayed communication skills through one on one
contact with customers. Demonstrated flexibility in
regard to work assignments and work schedule.

work.title: Event Manager
work.description:
Assigned roles and directed banquet servers and
kitchen staff of up to 80 people. Found solutions to
various problems that arose in an event while making
sure company standards were upheld

work.title: Lieutenant
work.description:
Planned, coordinated and lead different field
operations of up to 20 soldiers. Managed all aspects of
training, mentoring, and daily routines of up to 70
soldiers at a time.

projects.title: Game of Life
projects.category: The Game of Life, also known simply as Life, is a cellular automaton devised by the British mathematician John Horton Conway.

projects.title: Glasstrack
projects.category: My final project from LEARN Academy. A fullstack app that allows real time inventory tracking for a bar. The inventory tracks both bottle and individual glass sales.

projects.title: Location List
projects.category: Allows a user to search and add addresses as markers in a map, and display locations in a list.

projects.title: Tic-Tac-Toe
projects.category: The original Tic-Tac-Toe game built in React during my time as a student at LEARN academy

projects.title: Pig Latin
projects.category: Pig Latin translator built in vanilla JS during my time as a student at LEARN academy

projects.title: Shopping List
projects.category: A full stack application using the MERN stack, a simple interface that lets you add and delete your shopping list
